subject: pldmtool: Display GetPDR state set ID possible state names in an array
commitMessage:
pldmtool: Display GetPDR state set ID possible state names in an array

Note: Also, displays OEM state set and their possible states.
      Created new oem_ibm_state_set.hpp for OEM IBM PDR's possible states.

Example:

{
    "nextRecordHandle": 115,
    "responseCount": 27,
    "recordHandle": 114,
    "PDRHeaderVersion": 1,
    "PDRType": "State Sensor PDR",
    "recordChangeNumber": 0,
    "dataLength": 17,
    "PLDMTerminusHandle": 0,
    "sensorID": 93,
    "entityType": "[Physical] Unspecified",
    "entityInstanceNumber": 0,
    "containerID": 0,
    "sensorInit": "noInit",
    "sensorAuxiliaryNamesPDR": false,
    "compositeSensorCount": 1,
    "stateSetID[0]": "Identify State(17)",
    "possibleStatesSize[0]": 1,
    "possibleStates[0]": [
        "Identify State Unasserted(1)",
        "Identify State Asserted(2)"
    ]
}

{
    "nextRecordHandle": 125,
    "responseCount": 27,
    "recordHandle": 124,
    "PDRHeaderVersion": 1,
    "PDRType": "State Sensor PDR",
    "recordChangeNumber": 0,
    "dataLength": 17,
    "PLDMTerminusHandle": 0,
    "sensorID": 103,
    "entityType": "[Physical] System chassis (main enclosure)",
    "entityInstanceNumber": 1,
    "containerID": 0,
    "sensorInit": "noInit",
    "sensorAuxiliaryNamesPDR": false,
    "compositeSensorCount": 1,
    "stateSetID[0]": "Operational Fault Status(10)",
    "possibleStatesSize[0]": 1,
    "possibleStates[0]": [
        "Normal(1)",
        "Stressed(2)"
    ]
}

{
    "nextRecordHandle": 249,
    "responseCount": 30,
    "recordHandle": 248,
    "PDRHeaderVersion": 1,
    "PDRType": "State Effecter PDR",
    "recordChangeNumber": 0,
    "dataLength": 16,
    "PLDMTerminusHandle": 1,
    "effecterID": 116,
    "entityType": "[Physical] OEM IBM Firmware Update",
    "entityInstanceNumber": 1,
    "containerID": 0,
    "effecterSemanticID": 0,
    "effecterInit": "noInit",
    "effecterDescriptionPDR": false,
    "compositeEffecterCount": 1,
    "stateSetID[0]": "OEM IBM Boot State(32769)",
    "possibleStatesSize[0]": 2,
    "possibleStates[0]": [
        "P Side(1)",
        "T side(2)"
    ]
}

Signed-off-by: Sridevi Ramesh <sridevra@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Iae44b14dab071683c86fd65c95e984b9287eca80

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as dcdcd3b8347a05302f7f5983659a4864e7547d0d by ManojKiran Eda
This patch set also adds OEM State sets and their possible states as well, please explicitly callout that statement in the commit message.
Done.. Initially I was  doubtful If i need to add OEM_IBM condition.
I prefer this patch is reorganised so that OEM part goes into pldmtool/oem/ibm, such that the OEM portion could be easily replaced for another company.
can you add some documentation in this file ? atleast one lines for each enum would be helpful
why is this needed ? are you using anything from that namespace ?
i would like to see these maps defined in oem/ibm folder , and an OEM_STATE_SET/ sensor/ effectors have a range , so when that entity is in oem range, we can call & check the map from oem/ibm file.
same here as well , move these to oem/
+1, Because this hpp is oem-ibm, plse remove #ifdef OEM_IBM

this ifdef is redundant right ?

because if its oem state set, 
            if (type >= PLDM_OEM_ENTITY_TYPE_START &&
                type <= PLDM_OEM_ENTITY_TYPE_END)
this set will be succeeded.
I put this ifdef OEM_IBM condition because any other company can have they have their own set of values right

ideally, putting multiple ifdefs is not good, we should ideally have an handler created for oem ibm, and delegate the rest of the work to that , instead of doing the work on this file.

If there are 10 companies, having 10 ifdefs does not make a good solution right ?

So, i would suggest you to remove this redundant ifdef for now, and probably in a different commit come up with an oem ibm handler infrastructure similar to what we have in pldm.
create oem-ibm handler will be done in the next commit
Do you plan to push the patch in the near future? In that case, we can merge it together.
I will do this bit later.. until then can we merge it?
Ok, if need be create a Github issue for tracking purposes.

Created -> https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/issues/25

Tested this change with visualize-pdr tool and it works great.
